title: iMessage History: Denial & Gaslighting
description: Text messages showing family denial of obvious conflict and blaming the truth-teller

message_history.message: Thanks for dinner Mom! See everyone next week ðŸ˜Š
Dinner was so awkward. Dad completely dismissed Jess when she talked about her graphic design work. Said 'that's cute' like she was a kid.
Yikes. How'd she react?
She snapped at him. Called him condescending. He shut down completely, left the table, and was crying in the bedroom. Then everyone just... pretended nothing happened.
Hey, you okay? Last night got pretty tense.
What do you mean?
The thing with Dad at dinner? When he said 'that's cute' about your work and you got upset?
I don't remember that. Dinner was fine.
You literally called him condescending. He left the table.
I think you're misremembering. Nothing happened.
Jess, I was sitting right there. He was crying. Mom had to go check on him.
Why are you trying to create drama? This is exactly what you always do.
I'm not creating drama, I'm just concerned. It was uncomfortable for everyone.
There's nothing to be concerned about because nothing happened. Please stop.
Hey Dad, how are you doing? I know last night was tough.
I'm fine. What are you talking about?
The thing at dinner with Jess? You seemed really upset.
There was no 'thing'. Dinner was great. Why are you stirring the pot?
I'm not stirring anything. You were crying. I was worried about you.
I don't want to talk about this. There's nothing to talk about.
Mom, is Dad okay? He seems upset about what happened at dinner but won't talk about it.
Honey, I don't know what you think happened, but dinner was lovely. Everyone had a nice time.
You went to check on Dad in the bedroom because he was crying. I was there.
He just needed a moment. It was nothing. Why are you making a big deal out of this?
I'm not making a big deal, I'm just trying to understand what happened because everyone seems upset but won't acknowledge it.
The only person making this a problem is YOU. Everyone else has moved on. Maybe you should too.
Mom said you've been texting everyone trying to start drama. Can you just drop this?
I'm not starting drama. I'm trying to understand why everyone is pretending nothing happened when it clearly did.
This is SO typical of you. Always analyzing everything, making everyone uncomfortable. Just LET IT GO.
I'm not trying to make anyone uncomfortable. There was obvious tension and I thought maybe we should talk about it.
The only tension is what YOU'RE creating by bringing this up over and over.
Your sister is right. You're making everyone uncomfortable with this. Please stop.
I feel like I'm losing my mind. Everyone is acting like nothing happened at dinner when there was CLEARLY a conflict. Now I'M the problem for even mentioning it.
That's gaslighting bro. You're not crazy. You know what you saw.
Can we talk on the phone? I'm clearly not explaining myself well over text.
Fine. But I don't know what you expect me to say. Nothing happened.
